feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student built and demonstrated a working car-purchase financial tool that computes APR-based affordability scores and location/currency-aware recommendations with multiple example inputs. DRIVER stages (Discover, Implement, Verify/Reflect) show both conceptual design and concrete implementation/testing, meeting the standard for a passing financial application.
- Integrate AI: The student clearly integrated AI as the core decision-making engine (multiple example evaluations, country-specific APRs, scoring), used AI in implementation, and demonstrated reflective verification of AI outputs. While they noted and corrected inaccuracies, the integration is substantive and adds real value, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I decided to kind of create a car purchasing decision tool using ChatGPT in particular."

"To kind of put in perspective for, or to analyze it under the DRIVER framework, the part that we're trying to Discover is our income, our savings, our location, our loan term, our country interest rates."

"So, when you click Evaluate, this AI kind of tool assistant gives you a lot of information down here... it's saying that no, it may not be financially smart to buy a car right now. And the score that it gave us was an 18 out of 100... average APR... 7.2%."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (identified financial variables: income, savings, location, loan term, country APRs); Implement (described coding and GUI work to build the tool); Verify/Reflect (tested outputs, researched and corrected interest-rate data).
criteria.reasoning: The student built and demonstrated a working car-purchase financial tool that computes APR-based affordability scores and location/currency-aware recommendations with multiple example inputs. DRIVER stages (Discover, Implement, Verify/Reflect) show both conceptual design and concrete implementation/testing, meeting the standard for a passing financial application.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I decided to kind of create a car purchasing decision tool using ChatGPT in particular."

"To Implement, we used um, or I used personally coding. I used a mix of Java, HTML a little bit for the GUI, and another one called TextScript, I think. ... I used AI to help build kind of a framework, and then I was able to input like which things I wanted to put on here, how I wanted the GUI to look like, um, and all that good cool stuff."
"they were getting a lot of values wrong. A lot of the interest rates, I think for one the US one was like 15% at one point, and I was like, that does not make sense."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: identified a concrete use case (car purchase decision) and chose ChatGPT as the AI component.
- Implement: used AI in the implementation (framework generation, GUI guidance, live evaluation/scoring).
- Reflect/Verify: tested AI outputs, identified errors (interest rates), and verified/corrected results.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly integrated AI as the core decision-making engine (multiple example evaluations, country-specific APRs, scoring), used AI in implementation, and demonstrated reflective verification of AI outputs. While they noted and corrected inaccuracies, the integration is substantive and adds real value, meeting the PASS standard.
